p: In some situations, musical sources will agree at one level while differing at a lower level. For these cases, app elements may be nested to any level necessary. In the following example, there are three sources, two of which agree on the addition of a measure, but differ in the content of the added measure: When nesting app elements, it is important that the value(s) in the child rdg element's@sourceattribute must be a strict subset of the ancestor rdg element's@sourcevalue.
